title: Vlad Jr., Springer jolt Jays offense in Game 3 rout
content: The Blue Jays, after losing the first two games of the ALCS at home, tattooed baseballs all over T-Mobile Park on Wednesday, smashing five home runs and four doubles in a 13-4 rout of the Mariners to avoid facing an elimination game Thursday.

title: Kidd noncommittal about keeping Flagg at PG
content: Coach Jason Kidd praised Cooper Flagg's performance as the starting point guard in the Mavs' final two preseason games but stopped short of committing to opening the season with the 18-year-old rookie in that role.

title: Kings' Murray secures 5-year, $140M extension
content: Kings forward Keegan Murray has agreed to a five-year, $140 million rookie contract extension with the franchise, his representatives told ESPN.

title: Tua apologizes for comments: 'Made a mistake'
content: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa apologized Wednesday for criticizing teammates for being late to players-only meetings.

title: Ohtani: Two-way role not cause of hitting slump
content: Shohei Ohtani, who is just 2-for-25 with 12 strikeouts since the wild-card round, said Wednesday that he doesn't think pitching has affected his performance at the plate.

title: Source: 'Outrage' over surface at Steelers field
content: Players from the Steelers and Browns expressed "outrage" and concerns to the NFLPA about the "embarrassing" playing surface last weekend at Acrisure Stadium, a union source told ESPN.

title: Knicks' Brogdon retiring after nine NBA seasons
content: Knicks guard Malcolm Brogdon, a former NBA Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, has decided to retire after nine NBA seasons, he told ESPN.

title: Spirit star Rodman exits in tears, set for scans
content: An emotional Trinity Rodman had to be helped off the field because of an injury in the first half of the Washington Spirit's game with Monterrey on Wednesday.

title: 📉 Bottom 10: Franklin's last act at Penn State
content: After a stunning free fall, Penn State's coach is out of a job but still has a spot on our list of outcasts.

title: QB at No. 1 -- but not No. 2? We predicted the entire first round of the 2026 NFL draft
content: How many QBs could go in Round 1? How high might Rueben Bain Jr. go? Will the Buckeyes run Day 1? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: The legacy and legality of the Bush Push 20 years later
content: When Reggie Bush shoved Matt Leinart into the end zone, it saved USC's season and ignited a debate that still lingers.

title: NHL Rank: From 1 to 100, who will be the best players in 2025-26?
content: Connor McDavid remains No. 1, but who lands after? Here's who the ESPN panel believes is best for this season.

content: The NBA preseason wraps up Friday. Here are the most noteworthy storylines from 14 of the league's most intriguing teams.

content: In a pivotal WNBA offseason, a new CBA is being negotiated and there's an unprecedented number of free agents.

content: Las Vegas' 2023 title team topped our rankings two years ago. Where do the 2025 Aces and 2024 Liberty fit in?

content: Exploring the best potential destination for rumored trade targets and who benefits if a player is dealt.

title: Family seeks justice for man wrongly accused in KC Chiefs parade shooting
content: Denton Loudermill Jr.'s life spiraled after photos on social media claimed he was the Super Bowl parade gunman.

title: State of the NLCS and ALCS: Biggest surprises, what each team must do and more
content: Two games into both league championship series, we break down what we've seen -- and where each matchup will go from here.

title: Rocked by scandal, Portland Thorns aim to reclaim former glory under new ownership
content: Scandals and abuse allegations forced the Portland Thorns to find new owners, but decoupling from the Timbers organization has been a work in progress.

title: Our debut NFL rookie rankings: Three Giants in the top 10, plus big questions about the class
content: Who are the NFL's best rookies through Week 6? Which first-years are overperforming or underperforming? Here's our top 10 list.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do at midseason
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the playoff picture takes shape.

title: Best (and worst) offseason moves
content: Who has the strongest transfer and recruiting classes? Here are eight key developments that could shape 2025-26.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Don't be haunted by the ghosts of fantasy weeks past
content: Loza's thoughts on Dak Prescott, Travis Etienne Jr., Chuba Hubbard, Drake London, Rashee Rice, Matthew Golden and Harold Fannin Jr. populate this week's column.

title: Get ahead of Week 8 bye-mageddon by stashing these players today
content: Stash these players ahead of Week 8, when six NFL teams' worth of fantasy football stars will be on bye.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Chiefs, Broncos among top options in Week 7
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 7, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Ranking the 87 national teams that could win the 2026 World Cup
content: There are 88 national teams that could win the FIFA World Cup next summer. With only three international breaks left before the tournament, we rank every team.

title: Chelsea's Champions League response vs. Paris FC is just what Bompastor & Co. needed
content: With Chelsea's 4-0 win over Paris FC in the Champions League, Sonia Bompastor's team can feel a bit of ease going into the international break.

title: Why Spain's player production line is the envy of the world
content: What's remarkable about Luis De La Fuente's Spain is that despite getting stripped of their elite talents, they keep winning and thrilling anyway.

title: How 'Abbott Elementary' turned an all-time Kyle Schwarber performance into an episode
content: Abbott Elementary" continues to embrace Philadelphia sports culture, and its latest outing has the cast cheering on the Phillies.

title: Talent, emotional intelligence and a lifetime of sacrifice have made Oscar Piastri a F1 title favorite
content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

title: How to ace your salary cap draft
content: Are you ready for your salary cap draft? Jim McCormick lays out helpful strategies and tactics you can use to ace draft day.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs ready to bring Kane back from Bayern
content: Tottenham Hotspur are willing to pay Harry Kane's €60 million release clause to re-sign him from Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Odisha Man Poses As Maoist To Extort Rs 35 Lakh From Father, Arrested
content: In a shocking case, a 24-year-old young man was arrested on charges of attempting to dupe his father by posing as a fake Maoist and demanding Rs 35 lakh as extortion in Odisha's Kalahandi district, police said.

title: In Nitish Kumar's Bihar List, A Muslim Balancing Act, And Caste Equation Play
content: Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Janata Dal United (JDU) has fielded Muslim candidates in four seats for the 2025 Bihar assembly elections, carefully balancing caste equations with community vote banks in the politically sensitive state.

title: Video: Tanks Race On Afghan Streets. Taliban Says It Captured Them From Pakistan Forces
content: Hours before Islamabad and Kabul agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire, videos went viral on social media showing tanks racing through the streets of Afghanistan's southeastern Spin Boldak province.

title: 'Look Forward To Meeting PM Modi At NDTV World Summit': Sri Lankan PM
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya is "excited" to participate in the NDTV World Summit tomorrow at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. The Summit, to be held on 17th and 18th October, is a global conversation of immense consequence.

title: IndiGo And Digi Yatra Partner To Enable Paperless, Biometric Boarding
content: IndiGo and Digi Yatra have completed an app-to-app integration enabling seamless sharing of boarding passes between their respective mobile applications.

title: "Earlier, Even Mosquitoes Couldn't Thrive": Rekha Gupta Praises Yamuna Revival Ahead Of Chhath
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, along with Minister Kapil Mishra, on Thursday inspected the preparations for the upcoming Chhath festival at Kalindi Kunj Chhath Ghat, highlighting a significant transformation in the state of the river waters.

title: 'A Historic Homecoming': Sri Lankan PM Returns To Alma Mater Hindu College
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya on Thursday returned to her alma mater in India- Delhi University's prestigious Hindu College.

title: 'Hope She Says Same When Centre...': Minister On Sudha Murty's Caste Survey 'No'
content: The Karnataka government has accepted Sudha Murty's refusal to reveal her caste in a non-mandatory statewide survey, but wondered if the BJP-nominated Rajya Sabha MP would do the same when the centre conducts its exercise.

title: As India Sticks To Death By Hanging, A Look At Execution Methods Across The World
content: The Supreme Court is listening to a proposal to give convicts on death row an option of choosing lethal injection as an alternative to death by hanging as a mode of execution.

title: Watch: Controlled Blasts On Jammu-Srinagar Highway To Clear Boulders
content: Loud explosions echoed through the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway (NH-44) as authorities carried out controlled blasting to clear huge boulders blocking the road. The operation was aimed at restoring smooth traffic on the busy route.

title: Pics: PM Modi Offers Prayers At Andhra's Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday offered prayer at Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy Varla Devasthanam here in Nandyal district.

title: Largest Reported Digital Arrest Fraud: Mumbai Businessman Loses Rs 58 Crore
content: A 72-year-old businessman in Mumbai has allegedly been duped of a staggering Rs 58 crore in a 'digital arrest' scam orchestrated by fraudsters posing as ED and CBI officials, police said on Thursday.

title: Madhya Pradesh Government Hospital Under Lens Over Worms In Antibiotic Syrup
content: Amid child deaths linked to a toxic cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh, a government hospital here is now facing a complaint over worms allegedly found in a bottle of antibiotic medicine given to a child, officials said on Thursday.

title: Southwest Monsoon Withdraws From Entire Country: Weather Office
content: The southwest monsoon withdrew from the entire country on Thursday, a day after the usual date of October 15, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: No Employment Without Agreement: Karnataka's Draft Domestic Workers' Bill
content: The Karnataka Domestic Workers (Social Security and Welfare) draft bill prepared by the state Labour Department prohibits employment of domestic workers without agreement and mandates paying minimum wages to them.

title: Private Firm Employee Flees Jhansi With Railways' Rs 70 Lakh
content: A case has been registered against an employee of a private cash collection company after he allegedly absconded with nearly Rs 70 lakh belonging to the Railways from the divisional headquarters here, officials said.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids Several Areas In West Bengal Over Sand Smuggling
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday raided various places in West Bengal, linked to individuals and businesses found to be allegedly involved in a sand smuggling racket.

title: Donald Trump's Refugee Overhaul To Favour Whites: Report
content: US President Donald Trump is reportedly considering a major overhaul of the country's refugee system, and it may forever change the way people seek and are given refuge on American soil.

title: After MIT, Brown University Rejects Trumps College Compact Invite
content: Brown University declined the White House's invitation to sign an agreement that would grant preferential funding in exchange for a slew of policy changes, like Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) bans and limits on international students.

title: Nimisha Priya's Execution In Yemen Over Murder Stayed For Now, Top Court Told
content: The execution of Indian nurse Nimisha Priya, on charges of murder in Yemen, has been stayed for now and nothing adverse was happening, the Supreme Court was informed on Thursday.

title: Zero tolerance against criminals operating from foreign lands, says Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Shah asked all States to set up at least one prison cell of international standards in their respective State to counter the plea of poor standards of jails given by fugitives in foreign court

title: NCPCR seeks report on alleged ragging of Class 9 student at Delhi Public School, Nacharam
content: According to a complaint, the student was bullied by a group of classmates during a birthday celebration on the school campus

title: Operation Sindoor finest example of self-reliance in defence sector: Rajnath
content: “It had become a necessity for us to buy defence equipment from abroad, and indigenous production was almost non-existent”

title: Vellapally Natesan terms protests by Congress and BJP over Sabarimala gold ‘theft’ row mere politicking
content: SNDP Yogam general secretary says anti-government protests expose Opposition’s ‘political vulnerabilities’ in crucial election year

title: Northeast monsoon arrives early over Tamil Nadu; heavy rains lash many districts
content: RMC, Chennai, declared the simultaneous exit of the Southwest monsoon from the country and the onset of the Northeast monsoon rainfall over parts of the southern peninsular region, including Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal, on Thursday

title: 42% Backward Class quota in local body polls: Supreme Court dismisses Telangana's plea against HC order
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta dismissed the State’s plea against the October 9 order of the Telangana High Court

title: Death of Sindhi spiritual leader Sai Chanduram irreparable loss to spiritual world: Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi visited the Shiv Shanti Ashram in Lucknow on October 16, to pay his last respects to the revered head priest of the Ashram

title: Arunachal group pushes for Freedom of Religion Act implementation
content: The Arunachal Christian Forum is opposed to the Act, which the Indigenous Faith and Cultural Society of Arunachal Pradesh insists is not against any religion

title: Execution of Indian nurse on death row in Yemen stayed, nothing adverse happening, Supreme Court told
content: The Attorney General appearing for the Centre said that Indian nurse Nimisha Priya’s execution in Yemen for murder is stayed, with a new mediator involved, ensuring no adverse actions

title: Northeast monsoon sets in over Kerala, brings heavy rainfall
content: IMD says northeast monsoon rainfall activity has commenced over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Rayalaseema, south interior Karnataka and Kerala-Mahe region

title: India to host Asia Pacific aircraft accident investigators meet from October 28-31
content: India to host Asia Pacific aircraft accident investigators meeting in 2025, discussing processes, reporting, and safety improvements

title: ED chargesheets Elvish Yadav, Fazilpuriya for wildlife offence linked money laundering case
content: Elvish Yadav has been accused of generating, acquiring, and possessing proceeds of crime worth ₹84,000 from the monetisation of an “offending” video uploaded in 2023 that depicted live snakes and an iguana (a protected species of lizard)

title: ‘Not from backward community’: Infosys founders Narayana Murthy, Sudha Murty decline to take part in Karnataka caste survey
content: Sudha Murty reportedly said the couple did not want to participate in the survey since they do not belong to any backward community.

title: Grade I constable suspended for extorting money from college students in Neyveli
content: According to the police, Poovaraghavan, a Grade I constable attached to the Neyveli Township police station, had allegedly extorted ₹1.30 lakh in cash from a few college students who were found smoking

title: Tripura’s TMP threatens to quit BJP-led coalition government if indigenous people not given rights
content: In the 60-member Tripura Assembly, the BJP has 33 MLAs while TMP has 13, and the Indigenous Peoples Front of Tripura has one legislator

title: Hyderabad paediatrician’s eight-year long battle leads to FSSAI prohibiting usage of ORS on food products
content: This victory belongs not to one person, but to people’s power, all the doctors, advocates, moms, and influencers who stood with me, says Dr. Sivaranjani Santosh who persisted with legal campaign

title: Attack on CJI Gavai: Supreme Court cautions against ‘raking up’ incident, to hear contempt plea after Diwali break
content: The Bench, however, observed that CJI Gavai had displayed remarkable ‘magnanimity’ by choosing to disregard the incident and urging others to follow suit

title: Watch: Nayara oil refinery in Gujarat sanctioned by UK over Russia link
content: The British government has sanctioned Nayara Energy’s Vadinar refinery in Gujarat, co-owned by Russia’s Lukoil and Rosneft. The move, part of the U.K.’s latest sanctions on Moscow, comes just days after Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s trade mission to India.

title: After cough syrup tragedy, Madhya Pradesh hospital under lens over 'worms' in medicine
content: Drug inspector Anubhuti Sharma said, “A woman at the government hospital in Morar complained of worms in a bottle of Azithromycin oral suspension.”

title: IIT Madras, BodhBridge launch free entrepreneurship training for school and college students
content: Both programmes will be offered online with live interactive sessions from experts, course materials, case studies, and recorded sessions, a press release stated

title: Widespread rainfall hits Thoothukudi; holiday declared for schools
content: Tiruchendur and Kayalpattinam recorded very heavy rainfall in the past 24 hours ending at 6:30 a.m. on Thursday, with 146 mm and 154 mm respectively; Thoothukudi Collector K. Elambahavath has declared a holiday for schools across the district

title: Minister Priyank Kharge seeks disciplinary action against government officials in Karnataka having links with RSS
content: IT/BT and RDPR Minister writes to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah requesting him to ask the authorities concerned to issue a circular stating that government officials cannot have any link with the RSS or its activities

title: Bombay High Court rejects bail plea in Mephedrone case, citing commercial quantity
content: The Bombay High Court said that personal liberty must yield to public interest in NDPS offences involving commercial quantity.

title: PM Modi is 'frightened' of U.S. President Trump: Rahul Gandhi
content: U.S. President Trump recently said PM Modi has assured him that India would stop purchasing oil from Russia

title: India prioritises consumer interests in oil and gas imports, says MEA amid Trump’s Russian oil comments
content: The statement comes after U.S. President Donald Trump said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi told him that India will stop buying oil from Russia

title: Large-scale anomalies in voters’ list, postpone Maharashtra local body elections, say Opposition parties
content: The Opposition parties claimed that several constituencies in Maharashtra had duplicate voters, faulty EPIC numbers, several people using the same photo identity cards or an unreasonably large number of voters staying at the same address

title: Watch: Greater Flamingos create pink spectacle in Tamil Nadu
content: The Kodiakkarai Bird Sanctuary, also called Point Calimere, in Tamil Nadu’s Nagapattinam district has come alive as thousands of Greater Flamingos visit this season, turning the shallow wetlands into a stunning sea of pink.

title: DRDO-developed Military Combat Parachute System successfully tested at 32,000 ft altitude
content: This makes it the only parachute system currently in operational use by the Indian armed forces, capable of deployment above 25,000 ft, the Defence Ministry said

title: Watch: Crimes against women, children, and the elderly on the rise across India
content: India recorded 27,721 murder cases in 2023, a 2.8% decrease from 2022, according to the latest data from the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB). The NCRB report also revealed that the leading motives for murders in 2023 were “Disputes” with 9,209 cases, followed by “Personal Vendetta or Enmity” at 3,458 cases, and “Gain” with 1,890 cases.

title: Man’s skeleton discovered on terrace at Manjeri in Kerala
content: The police have launched an investigation after two workers, searching for a discarded flex board, stumbled upon the skeletal remains

title: Green rhetoric versus grim reality on protecting forests in Karnataka
content: The recent deaths of six tigers at MM Hills and repeated cases of man-animal conflict expose Karnataka’s continued prioritisation of infrastructure projects over environment, despite the loud sustainability rhetoric, argues R. Krishna Kumar

title: Three Information Commissioners appointed by government of Karnataka
content: Dr. Richard Vincent D’Souza and Dr. Mahesh Walwekar have been appointed State Information Commissioners for the Bengaluru bench

title: A.P. Chambers women entrepreneurs’ wing office-bearers take charge
content: Sakku Madhavi assumes the office of vice-chairperson of A.P. Chambers Central Zone, while Mamatha Rayapati takes charge as chairperson for Women Entrepreneurs’ Wing (Central Zone)

title: AIIMS Mangalagiri launches outreach vehicle on World Hospice and Palliative Care Day
content: AIIMS Mangalagiri provides holistic palliative care services to over 300 patients with advanced illnesses, promoting universal access and awareness

title: YSRCP demands ₹1 crore compensation for Turakapalem victims in Andhra Pradesh
content: Despite 45 reported deaths, the government provided compensation of ₹5 lakh each to only29 families, allege YSR Congress Party leaders, adding that the amount is ‘grossly inadequate’

title: Dharmasthala case: Activist booked for circulating false news
content: Belthangady police file case against activist for spreading false information about externment, sparking unrest in society

title: Full-scale aerodrome emergency exercise conducted at Thiruvananthapuram airport
content: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport conducts a successful emergency exercise to evaluate readiness and response capabilities with precision

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: JD(U) announces second list of 44 candidates for assembly polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked BJP workers in Bihar to reach out to every household to spread awareness of the schemes launched by the Centre and the Nitish Kumar government

title: Centre disfavours lethal injection as mode of execution: Supreme Court
content: Senior advocate Rishi Malhotra, who has filed the petition, said at least an option should be given to a condemned prisoner as to whether he wanted hanging or lethal injection as a mode of execution

title: India pitches for supply of Akash missile system to Brazil as Rajnath Singh holds talks with Brazilian Vice-President
content: The two leaders “identified priority areas” for joint work, including exploring opportunities for co-development and co-production of defence equipment

title: Bengal Governor files report on Durgapur gang rape to President, Home Ministry: Official
content: In the report, Mr. Bose has given a detailed account of his findings in the case and also about his interactions with the survivor and her parents who hail from Odisha

title: PM Modi brought revolution in urban development inspired by Sardar Patel’s ideals: Gujarat CM
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that Ahmedabad “truly exemplifies PM Modi’s mantra of Vikas bhi Virasat bhi

title: Anbumani accuses State govt. of scuttling his padayatra
content: Dr. Anbumani claimed the government was continuously lying about the job creation and influx of investments coming into Tamil Nadu.

title: Hitachi Energy’s next phase in Chennai at ₹2,000 crore to provide 3,000 jobs
content: Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa said that the Chief Minister on Wednesday met with Hitachi Energy’s leadership to finalise their next phase of expansion in the State

title: India’s biotech surge builds momentum but faces scale bottlenecks
content: Leadership in biotechnology will require India to streamline its ecosystem and channel resources into high-impact areas. The government, industry leaders, and academia need to consolidate funding, build integrated infrastructure, and reconcile regulatory standards with international best practices

title: BJD slams Odisha CM for making his conversation with West Bengal rape survivor public
content: Despite recurrence of rape and gangrape incidents in Odisha over the last 15 months, the CM remained silent, charged Sulata Deo, BJD Rajya Sabha MP

title: Young and jobless: key demographic weighs claims and promises of parties
content: NDA government says it has been distributing lakhs of appointment letters for jobs in different sectors, with the Chief Minister promising at several events that ‘one crore more jobs will be given in the future’; Tejashwi says lakhs of jobs were provided during the 17 months of grand alliance rule

title: CPI(M) seeks judicial probe into Dalit IPS officer’s death
content: The party also called for the immediate suspension of all officials named by the late officer to prevent any interference in the investigation

title: Chaos at Patna airport as Bihar Congress leaders are heckled by party cadre
content: Congress workers from the Bikram assembly constituency confronted the leaders when they arrived at the airport alleging corruption in ticket distribution.

title: FIR registered over ASI Sandeep Lather’s death; CM Nayab Saini, Opposition leader Hooda express condolences
content: His family gives consent to post-mortem; the deceased ASI had made allegations of corruption against the late IPS officer Puran and his family in a four-page note and video

title: Trump claims Modi has assured him India will not buy Russian oil
content: An Indian pledge to halt buying Russian oil would mark a potential turning point in global energy diplomacy, as Washington intensifies efforts to choke Moscow’s oil revenues amid its ongoing war in Ukraine.

title: Police deter escalation between groups over Ambedkar statue installation in Gwalior
content: More than 4,200 personnel are currently deployed in the city, including over 700 called in from neighbouring districts, along with arrangements for tear gas and other measures to prevent any escalation.

title: Cough syrup deaths: another child from Madhya Pradesh dies during treatment in Nagpur
content: Chhindwara Additional Collector Dhirendra Singh said the child had been admitted in Nagpur since September 14 but her condition did not improve

title: Lack of structure harmed us in 2024, says newly appointed Haryana Congress chief
content: Narender Singh told The Hindu that strengthening the organisation in the State and expanding it to the booth and village levels were his priorities

title: Balancing lives and conservation
content: Kerala amends wildlife laws to tackle rising human-wildlife conflicts while raising concerns over ecological impact

title: Bihar polls: BJP announces third list of 18 candidates
content: In the third list, BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: LDF takes out rally, holds public meeting in Perambra
content: Senior CPI(M) leader accuses Cong. activists of assaulting Perambra panchayat president without any provocation

title: Karnataka Social and Educational Survey: Enumerators struggle amid long hours of work and hostile responses
content: As on Wednesday, out of a total of about 46 lakh households to be surveyed under Greater Bengaluru Authority limits, a little over 15 lakh were covered

title: Karnataka to set up 300-acre data centre park at Tavarekere in 18 months
content: According to industry experts, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu are quite ahead of Karnataka in terms of data centre infrastructure

title: BSWML unveils waste kiosks to tackle garbage and black spots in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Limited plans to set up 76 such kiosks across the city, supported by transfer stations and community-level composting initiatives

title: BJP firefights as allies protest seat allocation to LJP(RV)
content: Two NDA allies, Upendra Kushwaha’s Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustan Awam Morcha, have publicly expressed their displeasure. JD(U) has also conveyed their objections while refraining from making any public remarks.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Saini assures justice and support to family of deceased ASI
content: His family says it would allow the post-mortem only after a case is registered, demands probe into four-page note and video left by him

title: Supreme Court issues notice on plea seeking access to lawyer during inquiry
content: The petition says that though the right to consult a lawyer during an inquiry is statutorily recognised, it is not uniformly enforced by investigating agencies

title: Battleground Bhabanipur: Mamata says outsiders filling up her constituency, Suvendu vows to defeat her
content: West Bengal CM says slums are being replaced by highrises full of outsiders, driving her voters away from Bhabanipur; Leader of Opposition says BJP leads in five out of eight wards in the constituency

title: ‘Anaesthesia of death’: How Bengaluru doctor’s 'cure' killed his dermatologist wife
content: A Bengaluru surgeon stands accused of murdering his wife, a dermatologist, by administering a fatal anaesthetic overdose. Initially ruled an unnatural death, an autopsy report confirmed the presence of Propofol, transforming the case into a cold-blooded murder investigation. The accused allegedly attempted to conceal his wife's death and prevent an autopsy.

title: 'We don't interfere': Moscow reacts to Trump’s Russian oil claims
content: Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov on Thursday stated that India's oil import decisions are driven by its national interests, responding to claims by US President Donald Trump. New Delhi has reaffirmed its independent energy sourcing approach, emphasising the importance of Russian oil for its economy and consumer welfare amidst global volatility.

title: Modi in Andhra: PM offers prayers at Srisailam Temple; to inaugurate key projects
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered prayers at the Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy Varla Devasthanam in Srisailam, accompanied by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu. The visit precedes the inauguration of development projects worth Rs 13,430 crore in Kurnool, spanning various crucial sectors. The PM will also visit a memorial dedicated to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

title: Hijab flashpoints across India: Classrooms to courtrooms; faith vs uniformity
content: From Kerala to Uttar Pradesh, recent hijab-related controversies in Indian schools and colleges have reignited national debate over religious freedom and institutional dress codes. Incidents include students being barred from class, alleged coercion, and police involvement. These cases, spanning Kerala, Jharkhand, Karnataka, and UP, have prompted legal petitions, official inquiries, and public outcry. They highlight the ongoing tension between individual rights and uniform policies, with parents, educators, and authorities responding differently in each instance.

title: From job offer to battlefield: Hyderabad man lured to Russia; forced to fight against Ukraine
content: A 37-year-old Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, was allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, where he was reportedly drafted into fighting the war against Ukraine. After jumping from an army vehicle to evade combat and injuring his leg, he is now being threatened to fight or face death.

title: Amazon: E-commerce giant to slash 15% of HR roles; more layoffs likely
content: Amazon is reportedly preparing for another round of significant layoffs, with its Human Resources division, known as PXT, expected to be hit hardest. This move comes as the company aggressively invests in AI products and infrastructure, with CEO Andy Jassy warning that generative AI adoption will lead to workforce reductions and increased efficiency.

title: 50% US tariffs: Indian refiners look to cut back on Russian crude imports
content: India is reportedly planning to gradually reduce its Russian oil imports, a move influenced by US pressure and tariffs. While refiners await official directives, the government prioritizes stable energy prices and supply security. Discussions are ongoing with the US for enhanced energy cooperation, potentially impacting trade agreements and tariff rates.

title: Now loading! Very poor air: Delhi-NCR AQI worsens within ‘poor’ category
content: Delhi's air quality worsened to the 'poor' category on Wednesday, with pollution models predicting it will turn 'very poor' before Diwali. Stubble burning's contribution to PM2.5 is expected to rise, accelerating deterioration. Noida breached the 'very poor' mark, recording the country's worst AQI for the day.

title: When and where Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will train in Australia
content: India's ODI cricket team has arrived in Australia for a three-match series, featuring stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma under new captain Shubman Gill. This marks their first international appearance since the Champions Trophy win. The series begins Sunday in Perth, with subsequent matches in Adelaide and Sydney, followed by a T20 series.

title: Milestone for AI in science: Google AI predicts cancer clue; scientists confirm
content: Google's advanced AI, C2S-Scale 27B, developed with Yale, has generated and validated a novel hypothesis on cancer cell behaviour. This AI understands cellular language, predicting that the drug silmitasertib could significantly boost immune system detection of 'cold tumours'. This breakthrough promises new avenues for cancer therapy, with the model now open-sourced for global research.

title: MP shocker: Man shoots, beheads cousin over 'affair' with his wife
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Sagar district where a 28-year-old man was brutally murdered and beheaded by his cousin and family. Suspecting an illicit affair, the attackers allegedly shot and then dismembered the victim. The victim's brother was also shot while attempting to intervene and is in critical condition.

title: Ditch these common bathroom mistakes to keep your digestion and gut healthy -
content: Your bathroom habits can impact your gut health. Experts warn that prolonged sitting, straining, and using smartphones can disrupt digestion. Simple changes like reducing toilet time and avoiding distractions can improve gut function. Paying attention to warning signs of gut problems is crucial. Making mindful adjustments promotes long-term digestive wellness.

title: 'Priority to safeguard interests': MEA reacts to Trump's claim on Russian oil; cites 'twin goals'
content: India's External Affairs Ministry clarified that the nation's oil import policies prioritize consumer interests amidst a volatile energy market. While discussions on deepening energy cooperation with the US are ongoing, New Delhi maintains its strategy of broad-basing and diversifying energy sources to ensure stable prices and secure supplies, a stance reiterated by the MEA spokesperson.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take break; warns of this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: When SNL's Colin Jost 'turned up' in Epstein video with Donald Trump
content: During Saturday Night Live's "Weekend Update," Michael Che used OpenAI's Sora to insert Colin Jost into a 1992 video of Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein. The doctored footage showed Jost dancing at the party, much to his visible discomfort and the audience's amusement. This stunt highlights AI's growing role in satire, blurring lines between reality and fabrication.

title: Watch: Bengaluru traffic police officer slaps man during routine check
content: A Bengaluru police officer faces suspension following a viral video. The footage shows the officer slapping a motorcyclist during a routine traffic stop. The incident has ignited public outcry on social media. Many are demanding accountability for the alleged abuse of power. An internal inquiry is now underway to investigate the matter thoroughly.

title: TVS Apache RTX 300 launched at Rs 1.99 lakh: Engine specs, features & more
content: TVS Motor Company has launched the Apache RTX 300, entering the adventure touring segment with prices starting at Rs 1.99 lakh. This new model features a 299.1 cc liquid-cooled engine, WP suspension, and four riding modes, including Rally. Bookings are open, with deliveries commencing November 15.

title: 'When you decide to give up': Kohli shares vague social media post
content: The Indian cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, arrived in Perth after travel delays for a series against Australia. Virat Kohli posted an inspirational message after the team's arrival, with the upcoming ODI series marking a potential last tour Down Under for him and Rohit Sharma, who have focused solely on ODIs.

title: Charlie Kirk sculpture showing Jesus embracing him trolled
content: Ave Maria University will soon feature a new sculpture of Jesus Christ embracing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, inspired by his recent death. Canadian artist Timothy Schmalz created the piece, which is expected to join the university's permanent collection next year.

title: IAS officer suicide case: 8-day impasse ends, daughters cremate ADGP Puran Kumar
content: Eight days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's death, his family consented to a postmortem following assurances of a fair probe. His daughters performed the last rites. Meanwhile, ASI Sandeep, who investigated Kumar, also died by suicide. His family demanded an FIR before agreeing to an autopsy, receiving assurances from the Haryana CM.

title: 'Cowards': India cricketer slams trolls for going after KBC Junior kid
content: A fifth-grader's appearance on Kaun Banega Crorepati sparked online backlash for his assertive demeanor.  Despite facing criticism, cricketer Varun Chakaravarthy defended the young contestant, calling out online abuse. The incident highlights the pressures on child participants and the harsh realities of social media scrutiny.

title: ‘Hurt by situation’: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan seeks parole to mediate Afghanistan tensions
content: Imran Khan, currently imprisoned, has reportedly sought parole to mediate escalating border tensions between Pakistan and Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. His sister revealed his deep concern over recent clashes and his offer to facilitate peaceful negotiations. The former PM faces multiple charges while violence flares along the Durand Line, causing casualties and territorial disputes.

title: Shoe-throwing bid at CJI: AG nods for contempt plea; curb on social media posts sought
content: Contempt proceedings are set to begin against lawyer Rakesh Kishore. This follows his shoe-throwing attempt at Chief Justice BR Gavai. The Supreme Court Bar Association sought to curb social media's coverage of the incident. Justices expressed concern over the court's time being diverted. They noted that action might further fuel the controversy.

title: World’s most powerful passports: India falls, US drops out of top 10 - check list
content: India's passport ranking has slipped to 85th in the 2025 Henley Passport Index, offering visa-free access to 57 destinations. This marks a decline from its previous position. Singapore leads the index with access to 193 countries, followed by South Korea and Japan. Several European nations also feature prominently in the top rankings.

title: Powerful earthquake in Indonesia: 6.7 magnitude quake hits Papua
content: A powerful 6.7 magnitude earthquake jolted Papua province in Indonesia on Thursday, according to the USGS. The tremor occurred at a depth of 70 kilometers, with its epicenter located approximately 200 kilometers from Abepura city. Fortunately, no tsunami warning was issued following the seismic event.

title: IPL: Kane Williamson joins LSG; welcomed by owner Sanjiv Goenka
content: Kane Williamson has been appointed as the new Strategic Advisor for the Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2026. The franchise aims to rebuild after a disappointing 2025 season. Williamson's leadership and strategic acumen are expected to be crucial in shaping the team's future.

title: 'Hard but necessary decision': Nestle to cut 16,000 jobs globally
content: Nestlé plans to cut 16,000 jobs globally over two years, with 12,000 white-collar roles targeted to save one billion Swiss francs. This aggressive cost-saving measure, aiming for three billion Swiss francs in savings by 2027, follows a recent leadership shake-up and a bottled water scandal, as the company navigates slowing growth and declining sales.

title: Chandigarh horror: Speeding Thar kills woman, sister critical
content: A speeding Mahindra Thar tragically killed one sister and critically injured another in Chandigarh's Sector 46. The 22-year-old victim, Sojef, was studying at Dev Samaj College. The vehicle fled the scene, and police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the driver, who is yet to be apprehended.

title: 'We lack pride': Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw blasts Bengaluru garbage problem
content: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw criticized Bengaluru's persistent garbage problem, calling it a "serious malaise" and blaming past governments' inaction. Her remarks drew criticism from Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar, who accused her of tarnishing the state, while Bengaluru residents rallied behind Shaw, demanding accountability for civic infrastructure.

title: Andhra Pradesh woman raped, robbed at knifepoint on moving train in Telangana
content: In a shocking violation of safety, a 25-year-old woman faced a horrific ordeal aboard the Santragachi Special Express. Traveling solo from Rajahmundry to Hyderabad, she was assaulted in a ladies' compartment while en route between Guntur and Pedakurapadu stations.

title: N-words, rape jokes and ‘I love Hitler’: Leaked Republican group chat
content: Leaked Telegram chats reveal shocking racist, antisemitic, and violent rhetoric from young Republican leaders across multiple states. Messages included Nazi references, racial slurs, and threats. Some accused individuals have apologized, while others faced consequences, sparking outrage within the GOP and calls for accountability.

title: ‘Respected scholar’: Indian-origin US expert Ashley Tellis denies espionage charges
content: Prominent Indian-origin scholar Ashley Tellis, a former Bush administration official, has been arrested by the FBI on charges of retaining classified documents and meeting with Chinese officials. His lawyers vehemently deny the allegations, stating Tellis is a respected advisor and will contest any claims of acting for a foreign adversary.

title: 'Frightened': Rahul slams PM Modi over Trump's Russian oil claim; launches 5-point attack
content: Congress has attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi. They claim he compromised India's dignity. This follows US President Donald Trump's statement. Trump said Modi assured him India would stop buying Russian oil. Congress calls Russia a close ally. They state relationships should not be damaged for personal ties. Modi is called a weak Prime Minister. His actions have unsettled foreign policy.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
content: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: Gold, silver price forecast: Will MCX rally last ahead of Diwali?
content: Gold and silver prices are showing strong bullish momentum, with experts advising investors to buy on dips. MCX Gold is trading around ₹1,27,000, with potential to reach ₹1,30,000. MCX Silver, outperforming gold, is near ₹1,60,000 and could target ₹1,63,000.

title: 'Most welcome': Pakistan's Khawaja Asif backs Trump’s mediation in Taliban conflict
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif has urged former US President Donald Trump to mediate in easing tensions with Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. Asif praised Trump's past peace efforts, calling him a leader who stopped wars and welcomed his potential involvement in current negotiations. The minister also bizarrely accused India of sponsoring the Taliban and waging a proxy war against Pakistan.

title: Inside Bengaluru doctor’s dark plan: Wife killed with anaesthesia overdose
content: A Bengaluru doctor, Mahendra Reddy, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his wife, Dr. Kritika Reddy, six months ago. Her death was initially attributed to natural causes, but forensic reports revealed toxic substances. Mahendra reportedly confessed to poisoning her, citing marital discord over undisclosed health issues. Investigations are ongoing.

title: IND vs AUS: Kohli, Rohit and Team India arrive in Perth after flight delays for ODIs
content: The Indian cricket squad, led by Shubman Gill, has arrived in Perth after travel delays.  The team, featuring stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, will compete in a three-match ODI series against Australia.  Kohli and Sharma, returning to ODIs after focusing on T20s and Tests, are expected to be key players in the upcoming fixtures.

title: Indore transgender dera: Feud between 2 factions turns into mass suicide bid
content: Dozens of transgender individuals attempted mass suicide by consuming floor cleaner in Indore, later escalating to a self-immolation bid outside a hospital. While authorities are investigating the complex motives, including alleged assault and inter-community disputes over leadership and property, the situation remains tense with ongoing protests and attacks on media.

title: 'Tied me up, took selfies': Greta Thunberg breaks silence on 'torture' in Israel
content: Greta Thunberg alleges mistreatment by Israeli authorities after her detention during the Freedom Flotilla. She claims guards subjected her to physical abuse, threats, and harassment, including being tied up and having selfies taken. Thunberg emphasizes the focus should remain on the Palestinian blockade, not her personal experience.

title: 'Getting out of hand': Ramiz Raja, Aamer Sohail bring up Asia Cup controversy
content: Pakistani teams received handshakes from opponents in hockey and cricket, a welcome sight amidst lingering tensions. Despite a dominant 93-run Test victory over South Africa, commentators used the moment to criticize India's past refusal to reciprocate sportsmanship, highlighting the ongoing impact of the Asia Cup controversy.

title: Biden moment? Trump fumbles on India, Iran; reiterates tariff claim — Watch
content: US President Donald Trump mistakenly referred to India as Iran twice while discussing a ceasefire negotiation between Pakistan and Iran. Trump claimed he threatened both nations with 200% tariffs to prevent a nuclear war. However, India's Prime Minister Modi refuted these claims, stating no global leader urged India to halt its response to a 'big attack' from Pakistan.

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin
content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30°C (86°F) Saturday is expected to peak at 34°C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

title: ALCS takeaways: Best moments, Game 3 hero from Blue Jays' dominant win
content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Mariners 13-4 in game 3 of the American League Championship Series . a barrage of home runs led to a dominant 13-4 victory over the blue Jays . the series leads the series to 2-1 after the blues dropped the first two games at home .

title: AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the 2025-26 preseason women's college basketball AP Top 25 poll results are out . the reigning champion UConn Huskies top the list, with the rest of last season's final four -- the UCLA Bruins and Texas Longhorns round out the top four .

title: Pochettino's turnaround has USMNT no longer dreading World Cup
content: Mauricio pochettino's men's national team won 2-1 against australia . the results have improved to the point that the team is unbeaten in its past three games . there is competition for places everywhere on the field .
